page.title: 07CITY TAKEOVER 2
page.content: Radyr is now a huge, sprawling suburb of Cardiff. Efail Isaf is only a few miles North of Cardiff and there is a fear that this will be the first of many such developments in the village. Apart from this, the residents point out that the very reason that they choose to live in the village was because it was small, quiet, secure and isolated. They travel to work and they travel to the shops. They like the idea of their children attending small local schools and the more personal education this brings. They like the idea of their children being able to play in the country and not have to walk city streets. This is the way they have chosen to live and they are fighting the efforts of developers to impose a new way of life upon them.
